channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A military coup attempt is underway in Bolivia, with troops and tanks on the streets
item.description: A military coup attempt is underway in Bolivia. Hundreds of troops and armored vehicles have taken to the streets of La Paz, surrounding the governmental palace and using tear gas on demonstrators.
item.content:encoded: A military coup attempt is underway in Bolivia. Hundreds of troops and armored vehicles have taken to the streets of La Paz, surrounding the governmental palace and using tear gas on demonstrators.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: California hopes to lure insurance companies back with extreme regulation overhaul
item.description: California's wildfire risk is so high, numerous insurance companies have left the state. Now, the insurance commissioner has presented a new plan to entice them to return.
item.content:encoded: California's wildfire risk is so high, numerous insurance companies have left the state. Now, the insurance commissioner has presented a new plan to entice them to return.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Venton

item.title: U.S. is seeing increased risk of dengue infections, health officials warn
item.description: The CDC warns of increased risk of dengue in the U.S. This been a record-breaking year for cases of this mosquito-borne virus in Central and South America, with more than 9 million cases reported.
item.content:encoded: The CDC warns of increased risk of dengue in the U.S. This been a record-breaking year for cases of this mosquito-borne virus in Central and South America, with more than 9 million cases reported.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: What Julian Assange's plea deal means for journalists who expose government secrets
item.description: Julian Assange avoids a trial or further jail time in the U.S. for posting classified documents, but his plea deal suggests journalists cannot count on sidestepping prosecution for publishing such government secrets.
item.content:encoded: Julian Assange avoids a trial or further jail time in the U.S. for posting classified documents, but his plea deal suggests journalists cannot count on sidestepping prosecution for publishing such government secrets.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Supreme Court has another embarrassing misstep in the release of an abortion opinion
item.description: As the justices were announcing opinions on other matters, the court briefly posted a decision that would reinstate a lower court order allowing hospitals in Idaho to perform emergency abortions.
item.content:encoded: As the justices were announcing opinions on other matters, the court briefly posted a decision that would reinstate a lower court order allowing hospitals in Idaho to perform emergency abortions.
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Social Security Commissioner Martin O'Malley agrees SSI program is outdated
item.description: A government program made to lift the poorest disabled and elderly people out of poverty is so out-of-date and complex that people often get kicked off. The agency that runs the program responds.
item.content:encoded: A government program made to lift the poorest disabled and elderly people out of poverty is so out-of-date and complex that people often get kicked off. The agency that runs the program responds.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Shapiro

item.title: Unauthorized migrants crossings have gone down significantly since executive actions
item.description: Homeland Security's latest report shows a 40% decrease in border arrests, three weeks after President Biden’s asylum restrictions and expedited removals executive actions took effect.
item.content:encoded: Homeland Security's latest report shows a 40% decrease in border arrests, three weeks after President Biden’s asylum restrictions and expedited removals executive actions took effect.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Insurance covers fewer drugs than in 2010 and they're harder to get
item.description: Insurance companies are covering fewer drugs than they did in 2010, and they’re making patients jump through more hoops and pay more money to get them. A report from GoodRx documents the issues.
item.content:encoded: Insurance companies are covering fewer drugs than they did in 2010, and they’re making patients jump through more hoops and pay more money to get them. A report from GoodRx documents the issues.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Medical groups challenge Israel's ban on evacuations from Gaza. Is Israel relenting?
item.description: Israel banned most Gaza patients from being evacuated for medical treatment, according to the United Nations and other groups. Now it could allow a group of child patients and guardians to evacuate.
item.content:encoded:
Israel banned most Gaza patients from being evacuated for medical treatment, according to the United Nations and other groups. Now it could allow a group of child patients and guardians to evacuate.

(Image credit: AFP)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Military flees Bolivia government palace, general in custody after coup attempt fails
item.description: The Bolivian general who appeared to be behind the rebellion, Juan José Zúñiga, was arrested after the attorney general opened an investigation against him. It wasn't immediately clear what the charges were against him.
item.content:encoded:
The Bolivian general who appeared to be behind the rebellion, Juan José Zúñiga, was arrested after the attorney general opened an investigation against him. It wasn't immediately clear what the charges were against him.

(Image credit: Juan Karita)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
